---
title: "Embedding Slides in Documents"
format: html
---

## Why Embed Slides?

You can embed revealjs presentations directly into HTML documents. This is useful for:

- Providing slides alongside reading materials
- Creating all-in-one lab documents
- Letting students review slides without navigating away

---

## Method 1: Simple iframe

Embed slides using an iframe with responsive sizing:

```html
<iframe
  src="../slides/lab1-slides.html"
  width="100%"
  height="500"
  title="Lab 1 Slides">
</iframe>
```

**Result:**

<iframe
  src="../slides/lab1-slides.html"
  width="100%"
  height="500"
  title="Lab 1 Slides"
  style="border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px;">
</iframe>

---

## Method 2: Responsive 16:9 Container

For better aspect ratio control:

```html
<div style="position: relative; padding-top: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden;">
  <iframe
    src="../slides/lab1-slides.html"
    style="position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;"
    allowfullscreen>
  </iframe>
</div>
```

**Result:**

<div style="position: relative; padding-top: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px;">
  <iframe
    src="../slides/lab1-slides.html"
    style="position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;"
    allowfullscreen>
  </iframe>
</div>

## Tips for Embedding

1. **Use relative paths** - `../slides/filename.html` from the demos folder
2. **Set a reasonable height** - 500-600px works well for most screens
3. **Add `allowfullscreen`** - lets users expand the slides
4. **Consider mobile** - the 16:9 responsive method scales better
5. **Add borders** - helps distinguish the embed from page content

---

## Collapsible Slides

Use a `<details>` element to hide slides until needed:

<details>
<summary>Click to show Lab 1 slides</summary>

<iframe
  src="../slides/lab1-slides.html"
  width="100%"
  height="450"
  style="border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px; margin-top: 1rem;">
</iframe>

</details>
